name: Blaine's Arcanine
Attack1Text: Blaine's Arcanine does 10 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: Discard 3 Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Arcanine in order to use this attack.

name: Blaine's Charizard
Attack1Text: Discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charizard. If all Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charizard provide 2 Fire Energy, discard all of them. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy discarded in this way.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokemon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

name: Brock's Ninetales
AbilityText: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach an Evolution card from your hand to Brock's Ninetales. (This doesn't count as evolving Brock's Ninetales.) Treat Brock's Ninetales as if it were that Pokemon instead. It can't evolve, devolve, or use the Pokemon Power of that Pokemon. During your turn, you may discard the Evolution card attached to Brock's Ninetales. This power can't be used if Brock's Ninetales is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Brock's Ninetales becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, discard all Evolution cards attached to it.

name: Erika's Venusaur
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to Erika's Venusaur.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 2 of them (or 1 if he or she only has 1). This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Giovanni's Gyarados
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage to each other Pokemon (even your own). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack.
Attack2Text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokemon, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and switch it with the Defending Pokemon.

name: Giovanni's Machamp
AbilityText: If Giovanni's Machamp would be Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, Giovanni's Machamp is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP become 10 instead. This power can't be used if Giovanni's Machamp is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

name: Giovanni's Nidoking
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon's maximum HP is 50 or less, it can't attack Giovanni's Nidoking during your opponent's next turn. (Benching or evolving either Pokemon ends this effect.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage; if tails, this attack does 40 damage.

name: Giovanni's Persian
AbilityText: When you play Giovanni's Persian from your hand, you may search your deck for the Trainer card named Giovanni, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Koga's Beedrill
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Koga's Beedrill stays in play (even putting Koga's Beedrill on the Bench won't let you use it again).

name: Koga's Ditto
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, Koga's Ditto's maximum HP is now 80 and Koga's Ditto's Pound attack's base damage is 30 instead of 10. (Benching Koga's Ditto ends this effect.)

name: Lt. Surge's Raichu
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage to the Defending Pokemon and discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Lt. Surge's Raichu. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, Lt. Surge's Raichu does 20 damage to itself.

name: Misty's Golduck
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Misty's Golduck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to each of your opponent's Pokemon that has any Energy cards and discard those Energy cards.

name: Misty's Gyarados
AbilityText: Whenever Misty's Gyarados attacks, flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, that attack does nothing. Instead, shuffle Misty's Gyarados and all cards attached to it into your deck. (This power works even if Misty's Gyarados is Confused.)

name: Rocket's Mewtwo
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch the number of damage counters on Rocket's Mewtwo with the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokemon (even if it would Knock Out either Pokemon). (It's okay if 1 of the Pokemon has no damage counters on it.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Rocket's Zapdos
Attack1Text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, attach 1 of them to Rocket's Zapdos.
Attack2Text: Rocket's Zapdos does damage to itself equal to 10 times the number of Lightning Energy cards attached to it.

name: Sabrina's Alakazam
AbilityText: Sabrina's Alakazam always has a copy of every attack your Psychic Pokemon in play have (including their Energy costs and anything else required in order to use those attacks, such as discarding Energy cards). This power can't be used if Sabrina's Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: You can't use this attack during your next turn.

name: Blaine's Ninetales
AbilityText: Whenever you attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to Blaine's Ninetales, remove 1 damage counter from it, if it has any. This power stops working when Blaine's Ninetales is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Ninetales.

name: Brock's Dugtrio
Attack1Text: All damage done to Brock's Dugtrio during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: This attack can't be used unless Brock's Dugtrio used its Lie Low attack last turn.

name: Giovanni's Nidoqueen
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage if you have at least 1 Giovanni's Nidoking on your Bench. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Giovanni's Pinsir
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: If you have any Benched Pokemon, flip a coin. If tails, choose 1 of your Benched Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Koga's Arbok
Attack1Text: Koga's Arbok is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If Koga's Arbok is Poisoned, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 20 and the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Koga's Muk
AbilityText: If an opponent's attack does damage to Koga's Muk (even if Koga's Muk is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads and if it has any, choose 1 Energy card attached to the attacking Pokemon and discard it. This power can't be used if Koga's Muk is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when your opponent attacks.

name: Koga's Pidgeotto
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage, and, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Koga's Pidgeotto. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Lt. Surge's Jolteon
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Lt. Surge's Jolteon, then flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Jolteon does 30 damage to itself.

name: Sabrina's Gengar
Attack1Text: All Pokemon Powers stop working until the end of your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Sabrina's Golduck
Attack1Text: Move 1 damage counter from each of your Pokemon that has any on it to the Defending Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Blaine's Charmeleon
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Blaine's Charmeleon. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Pokemon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

name: Blaine's Dodrio
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Blaine's Rapidash
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage (to the Defending Pokemon) and 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) If tails, this attack does 30 damage (to the Defending Pokemon).

name: Brock's Graveler
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each Pokemon on each player's bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.) Brock's Graveler does 50 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.

name: Brock's Primeape
AbilityText: If Brock's Primeape ever has exactly 10 HP left, shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power stops working while Brock's Primeape is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Brock's Primeape does 20 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.

name: Brock's Sandslash
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokemon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokemon.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Brock's Vulpix
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Erika's Bellsprout
AbilityText: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may take up to 2 Grass Energy cards attached to your other Pokemon and attach them to Erika's Bellsprout. This power can't be used if Erika's Bellsprout is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon, and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Erika's Bulbasaur
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Trainer card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Erika's Clefairy
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Benched Pokemon and put that card on that Pokemon. (This counts as evolving that Pokemon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Erika's Ivysaur
AbilityText: As long as Erika's Ivysaur is your Active Pokemon, whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to any Pokemon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack only does half the damage to that Pokemon (rounded up to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Erika's Ivysaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Giovanni's Machoke
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokemon and Giovanni's Machoke does 100 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Giovanni's Meowth
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the top card of your opponent's deck. If it's a Trainer card, put it in your opponent's discard pile; otherwise, put it into his or her hand.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Giovanni's Nidorina
Attack1Text: Giovanni's Nidorina does 20 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Giovanni's Nidorino
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If not, this attack does 20 damage.

name: Koga's Golbat
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Koga's Kakuna
AbilityText: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution card named Koga's Beedrill and put it on Koga's Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Koga's Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Koga's Kakuna is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

name: Koga's Koffing
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle Koga's Koffing and all cards attached to it into your deck (after doing damage).

name: Koga's Pidgey
Attack1Text: Put Koga's Pidgey and all cards attached to it on top of your deck. Then search your deck for any Basic Pokemon or Evolution card not named Koga's Pidgey. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Koga's Weezing
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage and Koga's Weezing does 30 damage to itself; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

name: Lt. Surge's Eevee
Attack1Text: Look at a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

name: Lt. Surge's Electrode
AbilityText: If Lt. Surge's Electrode is your Active Pokemon and gets damaged (even if it's Knocked Out), flip a coin. If tails, this power does 20 damage to each Active Pokemon. This power works even if Lt. Surge's Electrode is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when it takes damage.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

name: Lt. Surge's Raticate
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Lt. Surge's Raticate's Double-edge attack's damage (base damage and damage to itself) is doubled.
Attack2Text: Lt. Surge's Raticate does 20 damage to itself.

name: Misty's Dewgong
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokemon is Fighting, this attack's base damage is doubled.
Attack2Text: Misty's Dewgong does 20 damage to itself.

name: Sabrina's Haunter
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 30 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Sabrina's Hypno
Attack1Text: Choose 1 Basic Pokemon in any player's discard pile. Put it onto that player's Bench. Put a number of damage counters on that Pokemon equal to half its HP (rounded down to the nearest 10). (You can't put a Pokemon on a Bench that's full.)
Attack2Text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokemon. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Sabrina's Jynx
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon. Remove any number of damage counters from that Pokemon, then draw that many cards.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Sabrina's Kadabra
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a number of damage counters on the Defending Pokemon so that its remaining HP are 10.

name: Sabrina's Mr. Mime
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokemon and flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to that Pokemon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack.

name: Blaine's Charmander
Attack1Text: Use this attack only if there are any Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charmander. Flip a coin. If tails, discard 1 of those cards.

name: Blaine's Doduo
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Blaine's Doduo.

name: Blaine's Growlithe
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to Blaine's Growlithe. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Blaine's Mankey
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a card from your opponent's discard pile and put it on top of his or her deck.
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Blaine's Ponyta
Attack1Text: If you have any Benched Pokemon, flip a coin. If heads, switch Blaine's Ponyta with 1 of your Benched Pokemon.

name: Blaine's Rhyhorn
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Blaine's Vulpix
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, if you have a Fire Energy card in your discard pile, put it into your hand.

name: Brock's Diglett
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Brock's Geodude
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Erika's Jigglypuff
Attack1Text: You and your opponent remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokemon with damage counters on them.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon has no damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage. If it has any damage counters on it, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Erika's Oddish
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused; if tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.

name: Erika's Paras
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokemon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Giovanni's Machop
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Giovanni's Machop.

name: Giovanni's Magikarp
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Giovanni's Magikarp stays in play (even putting Giovanni's Magikarp on the Bench won't let you use it again).
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

name: Giovanni's Meowth
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused.

name: Giovanni's Nidoran ♀
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Giovanni's Nidoran ♀ does 20 damage to itself.

name: Giovanni's Nidoran ♂
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Attack2Text: You can't use this attack unless Giovanni's Nidoran ♂ has 2 or more damage counters on it.

name: Koga's Ekans
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused and Poisoned.

name: Koga's Grimer
Attack1Text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokemon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon and switch it with the Defending Pokemon. The new Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned.

name: Koga's Koffing
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokemon (including your own). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokemon.)

name: Koga's Pidgey
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Koga's Tangela
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw 2 cards.

name: Koga's Weedle
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Poisoned; if tails, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.

name: Koga's Zubat
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the number of Koga's Zubats you have in play. Before doing damage, you may search your deck for any number of Basic Pokemon named Koga's Zubat and put them onto your Bench. (You can't get more cards with this attack than you have room on your Bench.) If you do, shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Lt. Surge's Pikachu
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Lt. Surge's Rattata
Attack1Text: During your next turn, Lt. Surge's Rattata's Quick Attack's base damage is doubled.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Lt. Surge's Voltorb
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

name: Misty's Horsea
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, whenever the Defending Pokemon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. (This effect lasts until the Defending Pokemon evolves or is Benched.)

name: Misty's Magikarp
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Misty's Magikarp.

name: Misty's Poliwag
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, you can't use this attack during your next turn.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. That Pokemon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Misty's Psyduck
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. If exactly 1 is heads, draw a card. If exactly 2 are heads, this attack does 20 damage. If all 3 are heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokemon's attacks. Misty's Psyduck copies that attack except for its Energy costs. (No matter what type the Defending Pokemon is, Misty's Psyduck's type is still Water.)

name: Misty's Seel
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokemon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokemon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Misty's Staryu
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, return Misty's Staryu and all cards attached to it to your hand. (Either way, this attack does its damage.)

name: Sabrina's Abra
Attack2Text: This attack can't be used unless Sabrina's Abra and the Defending Pokemon have the same number of Energy cards attached to them.

name: Sabrina's Abra
Attack1Text: Look at your opponent's hand.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

name: Sabrina's Drowzee
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Psychic Energy card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

name: Sabrina's Gastly
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Return Sabrina's Gastly and all Energy cards attached to it to your hand. (Discard all other cards attached to Sabrina's Gastly.)

name: Sabrina's Gastly
AbilityText: Sabrina's Gastly gets +10 HP for each Psychic Energy card attached to it. This power works even if Sabrina's Gastly is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Sabrina's Porygon
Attack2Text: All damage done by attacks to Sabrina's Porygon during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Sabrina's Psyduck
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokemon is now Confused. If tails, this attack does no damage and Sabrina's Psyduck is now Confused.
